TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit WindowCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.IEnumerable
Public MustInherit Class WindowCollection Implements IEnumerable
public ref class WindowCollection abstract : System::Collections::IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Contains a object for each InfoPath window that is currently open.

remarks.para: Window objects represent the two types of windows that are used in the InfoPath application: the editing window that displays a form when a user fills out a form, and the designing window that is used in design mode when a user designs a form template.
The WindowCollection collection implements properties that can be used to access a form's associated Window objects, and it is accessible through the property of the object

Note: The WindowCollection collection can be used only to get the count of Window objects that it contains or to return a reference to a specified Window object. It cannot be used to create, add, or remove Window objects.

Docs.summary: Gets a count of the number of objects contained in the collection.
Docs.value: The number of objects contained in the collection.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed without restrictions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: The following example sets a variable to the number of windows in the WindowCollection collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.Window this[int index] { get; }
Default Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Item(index As Integer) As Window
public: abstract property Microsoft::Office::InfoPath::Window ^ default[int] { Microsoft::Office::InfoPath::Window ^ get(int index); };

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the Window object to return.
Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the specified object in the object.
Docs.value: A object from the object that corresponds to the specified index value.

remarks.para: The value passed for the parameter must be a number from 0 to the value of the collection's property minus 1.
After you have set a reference to the object that the Item property returns, you can access any of its properties and methods.
This member can be accessed without restrictions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: Because the Item property is the default property of the WindowsCollection class, it can be used as follows.
